short_summary: Purchase of a Versatile Tabletop Plasma Cleaner for R&D purposes
description: The Bio-Analysis Micro, Nano-Devices (Bio-AMND) section of the National Research Council Canada (NRC) has a requirement for a versatile, tabletop plasma cleaner for its R&D and low-volume production of plastic microfluidic devices performed in a clean room environment.
full_summary: ### **Tender Announcement** The National Research Council of Canada (NRC) invites proposals from experienced suppliers to provide a versatile tabletop plasma cleaner for the department's R&D and low-volume production of plastic microfluidic devices in a clean room environment. ### **Reference Information** - **Tender Reference Number:** cb-105-61873445 - **Solicitation Number:** 23-58183 - **Tender Closing Date:** 2024-01-12T14:00:00 - **Expected Contract Date:** 2024-01-12 to 2024-03-29 ### **Tender Overview** The Bio-Analysis Micro, Nano-Devices (Bio-AMND) section of the Medical Devices Research Center requires a tabletop plasma cleaner that can effectively clean plastic microfluidic devices for use in research and development activities. ### **Key Technical Requirements** - The tender requires a versatile, tabletop plasma cleaner capable of cleaning plastic microfluidic devices in a clean room environment. - The device must be able to handle low-volume production requirements. - The equipment's cleaning ability and safety features must be in line with current industrial standards. ### **Proposal Submission** Proposals should be submitted electronically to the contracting officer through the Government of Canada's Buy and Sell website ([www.canadabuys](http://www.canadabuys)) before the closing date. Interested bidders are encouraged to review the tender documents and frequently asked questions (FAQ) in the attachment section of this tender announcement. ### **Contracting Entity Information** - **Contracting Officer Name:** Carol Cooper - **Contact Email:** carol.cooper@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca - **Contact Phone:** (902) 293-8053 ### **Attachments** - A PDF version of the tender notice. - A PDF version of the FAQ section. - A PDF version of the Request for Proposal (RFP) document. Proposals must adhere to the deadlines specified and requirements outlined in the tender documents. It is the responsibility of the bidder to ensure their proposals meet the necessary conditions and specifications outlined in the RFP. I've kept the selection criteria narrowed down to the "who, what, when, and how" of the tender notice. Additionally, I used Gov Can’s Buy and Sell platform. These provide the new applicant with proper awareness package without having to sift through reams of redundant info and further guides user
